contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=September 2012}} The '''IBM 1013''' Card Transmission Terminal was a device manufactured by [[IBM]] from 1961 which transmitted the data held on [[Punched card|80-column cards]] to a remote computer or another 1013.<ref>{{cite web|last=IBM Corporation|title=IBM Archives Reference / FAQ / Products and Services|url=http://www-03.ibm.com/ibm/history/reference/faq_0000000011.html|accessdate=September 4, 2012}}</ref> The speed was generally considered 100 cards per minute but could be faster if programmed to send/receive only a portion of the cards if all 80 columns were not used. It needed a full-duplex circuit to operate but at any given time could only transmit or receive. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.computerhistory.org/collections/accession/102646606 "IBM 1013 Card Transmission Terminal / Communicating Reader-Punch" at Computer History Museum] [[Category:IBM unit record equipment|1013]] [[Category:IBM computer terminals|1013]] {{compu-hardware-stub}}
